item.title: Canada disability benefit bill passes Parliament
item.author: Rachel Aiello, Senior Digital Parliamentary Reporter
item.description: The federal government's bill to implement a new Canada Disability Benefit passed Parliament on Tuesday. Bill C-22, from Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Disability Inclusion Carla Qualtrough, proposes to create a federal income supplement for low-income, working-age people with disabilities, modelled after the Guaranteed Income Supplement.
